Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder, atop the Western Conference, ride a franchise-record 14-game winning streak.
Boston Celtics enter the game on a three-game winning streak, including two emphatic victories.
The Celtics have the league’s second-best offense and the third-best net rating.
The Thunder lead the league in net rating (12.1) and have the top-ranked defense (102.9 defensive rating).
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander delivered 33 points and seven assists in their latest win.
Alex Caruso (hip), Ajay Mitchell (toe), Chet Holmgren (hip) and Nikola Topic (ACL) are all out for the Thunder.
Jaylen Brown is questionable due to a shoulder injury for the Celtics.
The Thunder’s predicted lineup includes Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Cason Wallace, Lu Dort, Jalen Williams, and Isaiah Hartenstein.
The Celtics’ predicted lineup includes Derrick White, Jrue Holiday, Sam Hauser, Jayson Tatum, and Kristaps Porzingis.
